properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.additional-properties
properties.description: Additional properties for debezium components in case they can't be set directly on the camel configurations (e.g: setting Kafka Connect properties needed by Debezium engine, for example setting KafkaOffsetBackingStore), the properties have to be prefixed with additionalProperties.. E.g: additionalProperties.transactional.id=12345&additionalProperties.schema.registry.url=http://localhost:8811/avro

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.binary-handling-mode
properties.description: Specify how binary (blob, binary, etc.) columns should be represented in change events, including: 'bytes' represents binary data as byte array (default); 'base64' represents binary data as base64-encoded string; 'base64-url-safe' represents binary data as base64-url-safe-encoded string; 'hex' represents binary data as hex-encoded (base16) string

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.column-exclude-list
properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to exclude from change events

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.column-include-list
properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to include in change events

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.column-propagate-source-type
properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching fully-qualified names of columns that adds the columns original type and original length as parameters to the corresponding field schemas in the emitted change records.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.configuration
properties.description: Allow pre-configured Configurations to be set. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.debezium.configuration.OracleConnectorEmbeddedDebeziumConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.converters
properties.description: Optional list of custom converters that would be used instead of default ones. The converters are defined using '.type' config option and configured using options '.'

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-connection-adapter
properties.description: The adapter to use when capturing changes from the database. Options include: 'logminer': (the default) to capture changes using native Oracle LogMiner; 'xstream' to capture changes using Oracle XStreams

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-dbname
properties.description: The name of the database from which the connector should capture changes

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-hostname
properties.description: Resolvable hostname or IP address of the database server.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-out-server-name
properties.description: Name of the XStream Out server to connect to.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-password
properties.description: Password of the database user to be used when connecting to the database.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-pdb-name
properties.description: Name of the pluggable database when working with a multi-tenant set-up. The CDB name must be given via database.dbname in this case.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-port
properties.description: Port of the database server.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-url
properties.description: Complete JDBC URL as an alternative to specifying hostname, port and database provided as a way to support alternative connection scenarios.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.database-user
properties.description: Name of the database user to be used when connecting to the database.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.datatype-propagate-source-type
properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching the database-specific data type names that adds the data type's original type and original length as parameters to the corresponding field schemas in the emitted change records.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.decimal-handling-mode
properties.description: Specify how DECIMAL and NUMERIC columns should be represented in change events, including: 'precise' (the default) uses java.math.BigDecimal to represent values, which are encoded in the change events using a binary representation and Kafka Connect's 'org.apache.kafka.connect.data.Decimal' type; 'string' uses string to represent values; 'double' represents values using Java's 'double', which may not offer the precision but will be far easier to use in consumers.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the debezium-oracle component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.event-processing-failure-handling-mode
properties.description: Specify how failures during processing of events (i.e. when encountering a corrupted event) should be handled, including: 'fail' (the default) an exception indicating the problematic event and its position is raised, causing the connector to be stopped; 'warn' the problematic event and its position will be logged and the event will be skipped; 'ignore' the problematic event will be skipped.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.heartbeat-action-query
properties.description: The query executed with every heartbeat.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.heartbeat-interval-ms
properties.description: Length of an interval in milli-seconds in in which the connector periodically sends heartbeat messages to a heartbeat topic. Use 0 to disable heartbeat messages. Disabled by default. The option is a int type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.heartbeat-topics-prefix
properties.description: The prefix that is used to name heartbeat topics.Defaults to __debezium-heartbeat.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.include-schema-changes
properties.description: Whether the connector should publish changes in the database schema to a Kafka topic with the same name as the database server ID. Each schema change will be recorded using a key that contains the database name and whose value include logical description of the new schema and optionally the DDL statement(s). The default is 'true'. This is independent of how the connector internally records database schema history.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.include-schema-comments
properties.description: Whether the connector parse table and column's comment to metadata object. Note: Enable this option will bring the implications on memory usage. The number and size of ColumnImpl objects is what largely impacts how much memory is consumed by the Debezium connectors, and adding a String to each of them can potentially be quite heavy. The default is 'false'.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.internal-key-converter
properties.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize key data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.internal-value-converter
properties.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize value data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.interval-handling-mode
properties.description: Specify how INTERVAL columns should be represented in change events, including: 'string' represents values as an exact ISO formatted string; 'numeric' (default) represents values using the inexact conversion into microseconds

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.lob-enabled
properties.description: When set to 'false', the default, LOB fields will not be captured nor emitted. When set to 'true', the connector will capture LOB fields and emit changes for those fields like any other column type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-archive-destination-name
properties.description: Sets the specific archive log destination as the source for reading archive logs.When not set, the connector will automatically select the first LOCAL and VALID destination.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-archive-log-hours
properties.description: The number of hours in the past from SYSDATE to mine archive logs. Using 0 mines all available archive logs

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-archive-log-only-mode
properties.description: When set to 'false', the default, the connector will mine both archive log and redo logs to emit change events. When set to 'true', the connector will only mine archive logs. There are circumstances where its advantageous to only mine archive logs and accept latency in event emission due to frequent revolving redo logs.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-archive-log-only-scn-poll-interval-ms
properties.description: The interval in milliseconds to wait between polls checking to see if the SCN is in the archive logs. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-batch-size-default
properties.description: The starting SCN interval size that the connector will use for reading data from redo/archive logs.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-batch-size-max
properties.description: The maximum SCN interval size that this connector will use when reading from redo/archive logs.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-batch-size-min
properties.description: The minimum SCN interval size that this connector will try to read from redo/archive logs. Active batch size will be also increased/decreased by this amount for tuning connector throughput when needed.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-buffer-drop-on-stop
properties.description: When set to true the underlying buffer cache is not retained when the connector is stopped. When set to false (the default), the buffer cache is retained across restarts.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-buffer-infinispan-cache-events
properties.description: Specifies the XML configuration for the Infinispan 'events' cache

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-buffer-infinispan-cache-processed-transactions
properties.description: Specifies the XML configuration for the Infinispan 'processed-transactions' cache

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-buffer-infinispan-cache-schema-changes
properties.description: Specifies the XML configuration for the Infinispan 'schema-changes' cache

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-buffer-infinispan-cache-transactions
properties.description: Specifies the XML configuration for the Infinispan 'transactions' cache

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-buffer-transaction-events-threshold
properties.description: The number of events a transaction can include before the transaction is discarded. This is useful for managing buffer memory and/or space when dealing with very large transactions. Defaults to 0, meaning that no threshold is applied and transactions can have unlimited events.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-buffer-type
properties.description: The buffer type controls how the connector manages buffering transaction data. memory - Uses the JVM process' heap to buffer all transaction data. infinispan_embedded - This option uses an embedded Infinispan cache to buffer transaction data and persist it to disk. infinispan_remote - This option uses a remote Infinispan cluster to buffer transaction data and persist it to disk.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-flush-table-name
properties.description: The name of the flush table used by the connector, defaults to LOG_MINING_FLUSH.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-query-filter-mode
properties.description: Specifies how the filter configuration is applied to the LogMiner database query. none - The query does not apply any schema or table filters, all filtering is at runtime by the connector. in - The query uses SQL in-clause expressions to specify the schema or table filters. regex - The query uses Oracle REGEXP_LIKE expressions to specify the schema or table filters.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-restart-connection
properties.description: Debezium opens a database connection and keeps that connection open throughout the entire streaming phase. In some situations, this can lead to excessive SGA memory usage. By setting this option to 'true' (the default is 'false'), the connector will close and re-open a database connection after every detected log switch or if the log.mining.session.max.ms has been reached.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-scn-gap-detection-gap-size-min
properties.description: Used for SCN gap detection, if the difference between current SCN and previous end SCN is bigger than this value, and the time difference of current SCN and previous end SCN is smaller than log.mining.scn.gap.detection.time.interval.max.ms, consider it a SCN gap.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-scn-gap-detection-time-interval-max-ms
properties.description: Used for SCN gap detection, if the difference between current SCN and previous end SCN is bigger than log.mining.scn.gap.detection.gap.size.min, and the time difference of current SCN and previous end SCN is smaller than this value, consider it a SCN gap. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-session-max-ms
properties.description: The maximum number of milliseconds that a LogMiner session lives for before being restarted. Defaults to 0 (indefinite until a log switch occurs). The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-sleep-time-default-ms
properties.description: The amount of time that the connector will sleep after reading data from redo/archive logs and before starting reading data again. Value is in milliseconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-sleep-time-increment-ms
properties.description: The maximum amount of time that the connector will use to tune the optimal sleep time when reading data from LogMiner. Value is in milliseconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-sleep-time-max-ms
properties.description: The maximum amount of time that the connector will sleep after reading data from redo/archive logs and before starting reading data again. Value is in milliseconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-sleep-time-min-ms
properties.description: The minimum amount of time that the connector will sleep after reading data from redo/archive logs and before starting reading data again. Value is in milliseconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-strategy
properties.description: There are strategies: Online catalog with faster mining but no captured DDL. Another - with data dictionary loaded into REDO LOG files

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-transaction-retention-ms
properties.description: Duration in milliseconds to keep long running transactions in transaction buffer between log mining sessions. By default, all transactions are retained. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-username-exclude-list
properties.description: Comma separated list of usernames to exclude from LogMiner query.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.log-mining-username-include-list
properties.description: Comma separated list of usernames to include from LogMiner query.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.max-batch-size
properties.description: Maximum size of each batch of source records. Defaults to 2048.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.max-queue-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the queue for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 8192, and should always be larger than the maximum batch size.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.max-queue-size-in-bytes
properties.description: Maximum size of the queue in bytes for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 0. Mean the feature is not enabled

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.message-key-columns
properties.description: A semicolon-separated list of expressions that match fully-qualified tables and column(s) to be used as message key. Each expression must match the pattern ':', where the table names could be defined as (DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME) or (SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME), depending on the specific connector, and the key columns are a comma-separated list of columns representing the custom key. For any table without an explicit key configuration the table's primary key column(s) will be used as message key. Example: dbserver1.inventory.orderlines:orderId,orderLineId;dbserver1.inventory.orders:id

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.notification-enabled-channels
properties.description: List of notification channels names that are enabled.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.notification-sink-topic-name
properties.description: The name of the topic for the notifications. This is required in case 'sink' is in the list of enabled channels

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-commit-policy
properties.description: The name of the Java class of the commit policy. It defines when offsets commit has to be triggered based on the number of events processed and the time elapsed since the last commit. This class must implement the interface 'OffsetCommitPolicy'. The default is a periodic commit policy based upon time intervals.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-commit-timeout-ms
properties.description: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait for records to flush and partition offset data to be committed to offset storage before cancelling the process and restoring the offset data to be committed in a future attempt. The default is 5 seconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-flush-interval-ms
properties.description: Interval at which to try committing offsets. The default is 1 minute. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-storage
properties.description: The name of the Java class that is responsible for persistence of connector offsets.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-storage-file-name
properties.description: Path to file where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the FileOffsetBackingStore.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-storage-partitions
properties.description: The number of partitions used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the 'KafkaOffsetBackingStore'.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-storage-replication-factor
properties.description: Replication factor used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.offset-storage-topic
properties.description: The name of the Kafka topic where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.poll-interval-ms
properties.description: Time to wait for new change events to appear after receiving no events, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 500 ms. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.provide-transaction-metadata
properties.description: Enables transaction metadata extraction together with event counting

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.query-fetch-size
properties.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while streaming. A value of '0' uses the default JDBC fetch size, defaults to '2000'.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.rac-nodes
properties.description: A comma-separated list of RAC node hostnames or ip addresses

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.retriable-restart-connector-wait-ms
properties.description: Time to wait before restarting connector after retriable exception occurs. Defaults to 10000ms. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.schema-history-internal
properties.description: The name of the SchemaHistory class that should be used to store and recover database schema changes. The configuration properties for the history are prefixed with the 'schema.history.internal.' string.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.schema-history-internal-file-filename
properties.description: The path to the file that will be used to record the database schema history

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.schema-history-internal-skip-unparseable-ddl
properties.description: Controls the action Debezium will take when it meets a DDL statement in binlog, that it cannot parse.By default the connector will stop operating but by changing the setting it can ignore the statements which it cannot parse. If skipping is enabled then Debezium can miss metadata changes.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.schema-history-internal-store-only-captured-databases-ddl
properties.description: Controls what DDL will Debezium store in database schema history. By default (true) only DDL that manipulates a table from captured schema/database will be stored. If set to false, then Debezium will store all incoming DDL statements.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.schema-history-internal-store-only-captured-tables-ddl
properties.description: Controls what DDL will Debezium store in database schema history. By default (false) Debezium will store all incoming DDL statements. If set to true, then only DDL that manipulates a captured table will be stored.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.schema-name-adjustment-mode
properties.description: Specify how schema names should be adjusted for compatibility with the message converter used by the connector, including: 'avro' replaces the characters that cannot be used in the Avro type name with underscore; 'avro_unicode' replaces the underscore or characters that cannot be used in the Avro type name with corresponding unicode like _uxxxx. Note: _ is an escape sequence like backslash in Java;'none' does not apply any adjustment (default)

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.signal-data-collection
properties.description: The name of the data collection that is used to send signals/commands to Debezium. Signaling is disabled when not set.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.signal-enabled-channels
properties.description: List of channels names that are enabled. Source channel is enabled by default

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.signal-poll-interval-ms
properties.description: Interval for looking for new signals in registered channels, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 5 seconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.skipped-operations
properties.description: The comma-separated list of operations to skip during streaming, defined as: 'c' for inserts/create; 'u' for updates; 'd' for deletes, 't' for truncates, and 'none' to indicate nothing skipped. By default, only truncate operations will be skipped.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-delay-ms
properties.description: A delay period before a snapshot will begin, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 0 ms. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-enhance-predicate-scn
properties.description: A token to replace on snapshot predicate template

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-fetch-size
properties.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while performing a snapshot.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-include-collection-list
properties.description: This setting must be set to specify a list of tables/collections whose snapshot must be taken on creating or restarting the connector.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-lock-timeout-ms
properties.description: The maximum number of millis to wait for table locks at the beginning of a snapshot. If locks cannot be acquired in this time frame, the snapshot will be aborted. Defaults to 10 seconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-locking-mode
properties.description: Controls how the connector holds locks on tables while performing the schema snapshot. The default is 'shared', which means the connector will hold a table lock that prevents exclusive table access for just the initial portion of the snapshot while the database schemas and other metadata are being read. The remaining work in a snapshot involves selecting all rows from each table, and this is done using a flashback query that requires no locks. However, in some cases it may be desirable to avoid locks entirely which can be done by specifying 'none'. This mode is only safe to use if no schema changes are happening while the snapshot is taken.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-max-threads
properties.description: The maximum number of threads used to perform the snapshot. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-mode
properties.description: The criteria for running a snapshot upon startup of the connector. Select one of the following snapshot options: 'always': The connector runs a snapshot every time that it starts. After the snapshot completes, the connector begins to stream changes from the redo logs.; 'initial' (default): If the connector does not detect any offsets for the logical server name, it runs a snapshot that captures the current full state of the configured tables. After the snapshot completes, the connector begins to stream changes from the redo logs. 'initial_only': The connector performs a snapshot as it does for the 'initial' option, but after the connector completes the snapshot, it stops, and does not stream changes from the redo logs.; 'schema_only': If the connector does not detect any offsets for the logical server name, it runs a snapshot that captures only the schema (table structures), but not any table data. After the snapshot completes, the connector begins to stream changes from the redo logs.; 'schema_only_recovery': The connector performs a snapshot that captures only the database schema history. The connector then transitions to streaming from the redo logs. Use this setting to restore a corrupted or lost database schema history topic. Do not use if the database schema was modified after the connector stopped.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-select-statement-overrides
properties.description: This property contains a comma-separated list of fully-qualified tables (DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME) or (SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME), depending on the specific connectors. Select statements for the individual tables are specified in further configuration properties, one for each table, identified by the id 'snapshot.select.statement.overrides.DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME' or 'snapshot.select.statement.overrides.SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME', respectively. The value of those properties is the select statement to use when retrieving data from the specific table during snapshotting. A possible use case for large append-only tables is setting a specific point where to start (resume) snapshotting, in case a previous snapshotting was interrupted.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.snapshot-tables-order-by-row-count
properties.description: Controls the order in which tables are processed in the initial snapshot. A descending value will order the tables by row count descending. A ascending value will order the tables by row count ascending. A value of disabled (the default) will disable ordering by row count.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.sourceinfo-struct-maker
properties.description: The name of the SourceInfoStructMaker class that returns SourceInfo schema and struct.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.table-exclude-list
properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the fully-qualified names of tables to be excluded from monitoring

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.table-include-list
properties.description: The tables for which changes are to be captured

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.time-precision-mode
properties.description: Time, date, and timestamps can be represented with different kinds of precisions, including: 'adaptive' (the default) bases the precision of time, date, and timestamp values on the database column's precision; 'adaptive_time_microseconds' like 'adaptive' mode, but TIME fields always use microseconds precision; 'connect' always represents time, date, and timestamp values using Kafka Connect's built-in representations for Time, Date, and Timestamp, which uses millisecond precision regardless of the database columns' precision.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.tombstones-on-delete
properties.description: Whether delete operations should be represented by a delete event and a subsequent tombstone event (true) or only by a delete event (false). Emitting the tombstone event (the default behavior) allows Kafka to completely delete all events pertaining to the given key once the source record got deleted.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.topic-naming-strategy
properties.description: The name of the TopicNamingStrategy class that should be used to determine the topic name for data change, schema change, transaction, heartbeat event etc.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.topic-prefix
properties.description: Topic prefix that identifies and provides a namespace for the particular database server/cluster is capturing changes. The topic prefix should be unique across all other connectors, since it is used as a prefix for all Kafka topic names that receive events emitted by this connector. Only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, dots and underscores must be accepted.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-oracle.unavailable-value-placeholder
properties.description: Specify the constant that will be provided by Debezium to indicate that the original value is unavailable and not provided by the database.
